question: How many banks were nationalized in India in 1969?
explanation:
14 banks were Nationalized by Indira Gandhi in 1969. The following banks were nationalized :
  • Allahabad Bank(now Indian Bank)
  • Bank of Baroda
  • Bank of India
  • Bank of Maharashtra
  • Central Bank of India
  • Canara Bank
  • Dena Bank (Now Bank of Baroda)
  • Indian Bank
  • Indian Overseas Bank
  • Punjab National Bank
  • Syndicate Bank( now Canara Bank)
  • UCO Bank
  • Union Bank of India
  • United Bank of India( now Punjab National Bank)
